intro: Koeleria luerssenii, commonly known as the Lüerssen's oatgrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is a member of the grass family (Poaceae) and typically grows in alpine and arctic environments. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often covered in a fine layer of hairs. Koeleria luerssenii is adapted to cold climates and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
